answers.answer: OR when you get advice from someone who hasnt had a kid in over 20 years! Those are the people that irritate me! I have coworkers who havent had kids in years & they feel the need to jump in & tell me to do this & that... I appreciate the advice but its not needed. the further along I got, the more irritated I got with people trying to "help" me. Im not an expert by all means- but I have been around PLENTY of babies in the last couple years to help me answer alot of questions & to prepare me of what to expect. ha i understand completely! its annoying!

If you're not tremendously patient by nature, try to take these irritants as a little way of giving pregnant women the practice they will need for talking to their child.  When you're in the bathroom and outside the door is "Mommy?  Mommy?  Mommy?  Mommy?  Mommy?" or they drop something in the mud on the way to a wedding or they poop all the way up their back to their hat, you need to be able to laugh it off.  Take these officious advisors with a laugh, or a shrug, or at most a sigh, and you will be well on your way to calm motherhood.  )

Finally! I thought there was something wrong with me for feeling annoyed when I am bombarded with such "good advices". In my case it's my mom (32 years since her pregnancy) and her mom (over 50 years since her last pregnancy). I know they are only trying to help, but it's been decades since they experienced this, they don't remember everything clearly. Besides, what was thought to be right at that time might not be valid anymore. Hospital protocols and conditions, prenatal care have greatly changed since then. Plus, it's my pregnancy, it's gonna be my baby, not theirs! Pff..

Just to give an example: my grandma still thinks that when you're retaining water you should reduce your fluid intake. I kept trying to explain it to her that I am at high risk with preeclampsia, I need to drink a LOT more water not less! And she's the one getting upset in the end because in her times there were some doctors who believed that limiting a pregnant woman's water intake is actually healthy. Since then this has been written off in the books as a harmful experiment of the '50s and '60s!

Ive been raising other ppls kids my whole life. Now, im expecting my first. What really pisses me of is when ppl are all,  its different when its your kid. Im like all babies poop and pee!! I got this...Grrrr! Then theyre like, its jusy5 your pregnancy hormones....@$!#^^

People tell me the same about its different with your own kid. I helped raise my brothers kids since they were both born. I have had 6 kids all under the age of 7 for a whole week! It's jot hard. You get the hang of it when you grow up with younger cousins and 4 aunts to look up to.

Yes it may be our hormones but for real they needs to back off with the bombarding XD what we dont know we will learn and honestly its not that hard... yea ur up alot and its tireing, exausting and will feel hard, but the acts arent only for rocket scientist XD n the bombarding of your child saying mommy mommy mommy and bugging you i feel is diffrent lol
